Description: A fragment of ivory: probably from the lid of a box, with smooth surfaces and well-finished edges. The upper surface bears an incised inscription, showing the serekh of Den and the royal cobra. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 25 and pl. VII, 12; R. Weill, 'IIe' et 'IIIe Dynasties', 72; Musée de la Vielle Charité, 'L’Egypte des millénaires obscurs' (Marseilles, 1990), , pp. 90, 106 [461].
